meanings.definition: Used to express disbelief or impatience.
meanings.sent1: Pshaw! I can't believe you said that!
meanings.sent2: Oh, pshaw! You must be joking.
meanings.sent3: Pshaw, you really think I would fall for that?
meanings.sent4: When he heard the news, he exclaimed, 'Pshaw, that can't be true!'
meanings.sent5: The little girl stamped her foot and shouted, 'Pshaw, I don't want to go to bed!'

meanings.definition: Used to dismiss something as unimportant or unworthy of consideration.
meanings.sent1: Don't pshaw my ideas; they are valuable.
meanings.sent2: She always pshaws any criticism directed at her.
meanings.sent3: He pshawed the suggestion, but later regretted not listening.
meanings.sent4: The old man pshawed the new technology, but soon found it indispensable.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pshawed the student's excuse, demanding the truth instead.
